description:
We had catering with Taboun for about 25 people, and it was a great choice! We ordered 1 large veggie platter, 1 mixed kabob platter, and 1 medium salad and it was more than enough food for the group. They were ready on time and it was perfect temperature. 

I grew up with this food, and I really was impressed. Their falafels were on point, were not dry at all (which can commonly happen)...they were incredible! The amount of veggie/meat options were perfect for our group, and we're big eaters.
author: Michelle N.

description:
I will not be going back EVER !!! Before I condemn a place I try it again. First of all I was in full dress (uniform) and was entitled to a 10% discount, whatever. The lame excuse from the lady behind the counter was the bill's already rung up. Ok, but what part of my repping didn't you see? Christ my call letters pretty much jump out at you. Then I feel obliged to drop a tip because I don't wanna come out of this hellhole with food poisoning because the food isn't FRESH.

Again, cold falafel, the hummus was ok, baba gounoosh not fresh, ditto the tabuli salad. Christ, how do you stay in business serving up this slop?
author: Henry K.

description:
I can't believe it took me this long to find this gem. I have lived not too far from this restaurant and I can't believe I have not gone sooner. The food there was good and the portions are very generous. 

Some dishes that you should consider trying: 
+Baba ganoush 
+Lentil rice (side) 
+Hummus 
+Lamb kabob 

The lamb was not overcooked and they gave us a good amount of meat. The side of rice that came with the lamb kabob place was also really good and very fragrant. You are able to choose two sides with your entree plate, which I appreciated. They had a wide variety of sides to choose from. Their fries were decent (but they gave you a lot of fries if you order this as a choice of side). They also had a very tasty Mediterranean salad, which I really enjoyed. Overall, I would come back to this place again and I would recommend this place to people who are looking for some good Mediterranean food.
author: Lynn T.

description:
The food is pretty good, especially the falafel.
But they're kinda sketchy with pricing (judging from my experience and other reviews on this page). They were hesitant to give out an advertised discount, and have recently introduced a new "non-cash fee" if you pay by card. The cashier told me they don't know what it's about just pointed to a paper that said something about tax... hmmm.
author: Conscious C.

description: Meh. This place was not amazing. It's okay. I was hoping for a more fresh tabouli salad.  The bread and baba ganoush were decent but the shawarma was filled with juices and no taziki. Mostly cucumbers and pickles. Not my favorite place.
author: Lulu K.

description: Overcharged us for items / not clear on pricing when we asked then seemed to add money for sides despite the plate coming with sides? 1 dollar sign but ended up leaving paying over $30  food that wasn't fresh or great, won't be visiting again.
author: Matt M.

description: Tiny little restaurant with good food. I got the Dolmas, Baba Ghanoush and the lamb beef schwarma. Liked the mural on the food.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Soooo good! The combination of ambiance, service, food, food quantity, and prices has me smiling with two thumbs up. This place is just amazing.

I had the vegetarian combo plate - all of the expected items were there; falafel, hummus, dolmas, taboule, baba, and cucumber/tomato salad - plus pita! Everything was so good!

I had enough food for two meals! 

Friendly service - I was eyeing the eggplant, and as a surprise, they added a few pieces to my plate! So nice of them!

Cute spot. Il go back for sure !
author: Jenna M.

description: Came here and tried the falafel. They were fantastic!!! They are .50 cents each, so you can decide how ever many you want. I wasn't too hungry and wanted something small. My eyes went straight to the falafel appetizer. I ordered 6 falafel balls with pita bread. The whole order came up to $3.80 cents. I thought the falafel were gonna be small  but they were actually pretty big. The girl at the counter was super nice and gave a warm welcome.
author: Mario L.

description:
I am Armenian and I enjoy going to Taboun and having their delicious food which made me feel like home. I ordered my graduation catering from this restaurant and their services were amazing. Mouris was so helpful on the phone and made sure everything got delivered on time for our event! He did not charge us extra for the delivery which was very nice of him since we ordered food for almost 50 people. Portions were huge and all of our guests were so happy with the quality of the food.
I highly recommend this place:)
author: Meghrik A.

description: Best Mediterranean food I've tried, Love it so much!!! I'd definitely recommend this place. Nice staff.
author: Dreamm K.

description: Best little Mediterranean spot in the city! From the staff to the food you cannot go wrong. 10/10
author: Katie W.

description: Still sitting here, recuperating from the deliciousness that was my meal: chicken shawarma plate with dolmas and baba ganoush. One of the best shawarma plates I've had! Sooo yummy. Everyone working was very sweet as well. Highly recommended!
author: Yasmine S.

description:
First review since I received my shiny yelp elite badge for 2017!!!!!!

Happy to say this place gets two thumbs up! From their friendly service to the delicious food, I'm delighted to give this place an awesome review. I came around 3:30pm with my coworkers and one of my coworkers came early to order & pay for our meal! She's the sweetest! Love you, Maria! 

Because of her, it came out when we got there so it was nice & fresh. I ordered the chicken kebab dinner plate which included rice and two sides! Just $13.95, this plate can serve as two meals. I had plenty to take home to the boyfriend. For my sides, I got two falafels & hummus which came with warm pita bread. Everything tasted delicious. My coworkers ordered the lamb which they both enjoyed. I stole some of their cucumber tabbouleh which was delicious!!!! I couldn't get enough.

I would definitely come back again if I come back to work at UCSF. Sadly, I will be quitting to start school but I'll still be in the area so I may pop in for a wrap or two. There's plenty of seating areas at least at the time we went (between lunch and dinner). And best of all, I love how it's just a skip and a hop down Parnassus from the UCSF Med Center where I work. It's also very accessible by public transportation via the N or the bus (43 or 6). Any way you get here, you'll find it was worth the journey.
author: Brittany D.

description:
This is a great place for a quick lunch or dinner. I've only had their kabob plates, but they're incredible: well cooked and full of fresh flavors. No frills here--just good food.

There are a few seats outside which can be really nice in good weather. Otherwise the seating inside works fine.
author: Jackson B.

description: Great food, huge portions- what more can you ask for?! A cute, humble place with great staff. Would definitely recommend for takeout or a quick bite with a friend!
author: Ellen T.

description: Wonderful food, reasonably priced, and very nice staff. This was a great experience. I'll definitely be coming back. Get the lamb-beef shawarma plate. Superb.
author: Justin M.

description: Great place! Would totally come here again. Food was fresh and tasty. It's totally my new spot to order Mediterranean food. And I can get it delivered too.
author: Mark M.

description: Stopped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I was a little skeptical at first, but the prices were reasonable, the food was delicious, and the portions were huge.  Went with friends and we all enjoyed this place. Will be heading back again!
author: Tammy S.

description: This place gives discounts to UCSF students! Unfortunately, neither me nor my friend went there, so we couldn't capitalize on that. Very much "grandma's" cooking, the lady behind the counter was so friendly and warm and constantly asked us if we had enough, that there was water if the spicy sauce was too spicy. I felt at home here! Will come here again. We found this place initially because Zazie's was too full and this place was a short walk away, but I'm glad we came here instead. Clean eating area, clean bathrooms, lovely service!
author: Carol L.

description: The food here was SO GOOD. Love all the side options- falafel and hummus were delicious!! The portions were generous and the pita included. This will definitely be my new go-to mediterranean take-out spot.
author: Rachel B.

description: Fresh, delicious Mediterranean food. Every dish was nicely balanced, flavorful, and made with care. You order at the counter and the friendly folks there will take care of you. I got the vegetarian combo (only ~$10) and was satisfied with enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow.
author: Colleen S.

description: Very nice food, awesome service. Owner was very courteous and made us understand the details of menu items, he also suggested us which could be faster to serve as we were in a hurry. Food was very very tasty, hummus and falafel were amazing.
author: Shantanu G.

description: Clean fresh food everything was delicious the cashier insisted to give me my food to go but I insisted to stay it was funny and I'm sure he didn't mean too unless it happens again very nice guy though  had me try few salads to decide on my sides great service and food
author: Hashem K.

description: I bet you another shawarma if you finish your first! Unless if you are a fat A** you wont be able to eat more than one shawarma. It makes you super full! It's a Fat A** Shawarma over here! Good taste! Good customer service, nice people. Fat A** pieces of Flafel! A little spicy. Good stuff. I go there whenever I get the chance to!
author: Mahmoud A.

description: Just moved into the area and tried the Vegetarian Plate. Great portion size (enough for 2!), fresh, and absolutely delicious. If everything on the menu is this good I'll be eating here a lot!
author: Helen G.

description:
I ask for beef only but he gave me lamb & beef shawarma wrap I hate lamb. My husband had the chicken shawarma wrap. They were cheap on the chicken. The lady (I think is the owner was trying to do everything from cooking, preparing and working next door at the flower shop. I wish she paid attention to one or the other. The guy who took our order was clueless to what was in the ingredients ic the food. Thank god My husband ordered the vegetarian combo which was a plate of hummus, a small block of feta cheese, hard falafel balls, baba ghanouj, raw onions, and store bought tasting pita bread, and 2 dolma stuffed with rice and boring seasonings, tabouleh salad. Not too impress. I ask the guy what it was stuff with and he did not know. He did not know slot of things. Pricey, and they were stingy in the portion. The guy said the dolma was store bought 0 0
                                                                         0
author: Wolfie M.

description: Excellent food and service every time. Thanks for the extras today Mama! Always enjoying the good Middle Eastern flavors since 2013.
author: Nate A.

description: Friendly staff, big portions great price.  Bonus if you work st UCSF you get a discount
author: Paula M.

description: One of my fav Mediterranean food in SF.. small and cozy.. also recommend for take out..
author: Sheena ..

description: This place is great I always order through allset  with their promo code and order the lamb schwarma wrap.
author: Ethan B.

description: This review is for the liquor/convenience store section of the family business that runs both the restaurant and liquor store. Typically the older family members at the register are friendly and pleasant. Tonight the younger dark haired/dark skinned male family member was an absolute dick. I questioned the pricing on items that didn't have price tags associated. He answered several times changing the prices a couple times on each item. I therefore didn't have any confidence that he actually knew the prices and therefore was making them up on the spot. He didn't appreciate that I questioned him and kicked me out without letting me buy the items I wanted. You've permanently lost my business and will always order from Amazon and Whole Foods. I was trying to honor and support local business but you blew it. No wonder mom and pop businesses are being pushed out of the city. What's the point when you have to deal with egotistical asshole attitudes from the owner's son?
author: T L.

description: Excellent food!! Great service and just wonderful overall. I'll be coming back from now on!!
author: Rebeca R.

description: Very good food and excellent service!!! Taboun salad excellent! Great chicken shawarma and hummus!
author: Jane C.

description:
Got the Chicken Kebabs with hummus and falafel  
Walnut Baklava was bomb. 
Beef and Lamb shawarma was bombbbbbb

Highly recommend.
author: Anne B.

description: As the neighborhood mom and pop stores and restaurants disappear, it's nice to see that places like this still exist. The service is fast and friendly and the food is always great. Okay, maybe the atmosphere is not French Laundry, but it's cozy and quiet, and for me that goes a long way.
author: Richard C.

description: Such great food! Just started working at UCSF and was so glad to find this place.  As a vegan, they have many great options.  The falafel and hummus are my favorite.
author: Julie R.

description:
This place deserve 10 stars not only 5
great service workers have great personalities 
the food delicious 
Very clean my friend is gluten free they made sure that the food she got it was gluten free I recommend them 100% love this place
author: Miray A.

description: Came here twice and tried chicken shawarma and beef&lamb shawarma, both were great. Pretty good Mediterranean food with big portions.
author: Berk G.

description:
I went to this place because its down the street from where I work.  I was having a 50 person meeting the following day that needed to be catered.  The couple that owns this place is sooo nice and were easy to work with.  I was able to give them a budget that I needed to stay within and they took it from there.  Also, although they don't deliver, they did do it for us and they were even a few minutes early.  The spread was great and our employees were VERY satisfied with how everything taste.
Everything we got:
Tray of rice&lentils
Tray of pitas
Tray of falafels
2 combo meat platters
2 veggie side platters
Tubs of sauce
author: Aletta A.

description:
Popped in here this past weekend for a quick lunch with a couple friends. We were very warmly greeted by the friendly staff right off the bat. Food was prepared quickly and even brought outside for us. Got a falafel appetizer which was tasty. Also got a falafel wrap and 2 chicken shwarma wraps. Very good size portions and the prices are decent for the city.

Knocking off a star because the chicken could have used a lot more seasoning and would have appreciated some additional toppings in the wraps. I'm used to getting pickled turnips, etc in my wraps which make them so much better. However, I'll happily eat here again when in the area.
author: Foodie S.

description: Delicious!!!! First place I have found in SF with shwarma on a spit. Tasty flavors, decent prices, highly recommend (and this is coming from a Lebanese person!)
author: Lauren G.

description: I must've came on an off-night because the Lamb-Beef Shawarma I got to-go had absolutely no girth to it and by the time I got home, the Shawarma had leaked through the tinfoil wrapping and paper bag and all down my jeans. I opened up the bag and found that my Shawarma was mostly cucumbers and a stingy, paltry amount of lamb and beef. I expected more for the price.
author: Frank F.

description: The wraps are amazing. The atmosphere feels like home. The owner and the whole staff is very welcoming. I highly recommend coming to Taboun and trying anything on the menu. Authentic and affordable!
author: Hilal H.

description: It was ok. I have had much better. The dolmas did not live up to the ones I have had at the Greek festival in Vallejo, Ca. The rest of the food could use some more spice and seasoning. Just found it bland. They gave me a  nice big serving of pita with my plate which was nice.  The restaurant was pleasant and the staff was nice.
author: Eden V.

description:
Pros:  The falafels were tasty with a good crunchy crust; the wraps are humungus; the baba ghanouj was tasty; the prices were very reasonable.

Cons:  The beef/lamb shawirma on the dinner plate was really chips of meat on a bed of rice, making it seem as if there were more than there actually was; the wait for the food preparation seemed excessively long.
author: Dirty D.

description: Tasty super falafel, includes eggplant and potato, asked for spicy and it had zero heat. Ask for a side of the delicious hot sauce.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: So far the best middle eastern restaurant I've been in the Bay. Good Options. Good Price. The vegetarian Combo is close to 5 Stars. I would take people out of town to this restaurant as it is really good!
author: Christian D.

description: OMG! The food here it's delicious. Gluten free options are available, just trade the traditional rice for the one with lentils. The dish kebab was very juicy I asked for medium well, and it was amazing. The dolma it's sour just like I like it, salad so fresh and good, this is just the food. The staff was so friendly and helpful, when they noticed my rice had wheat they immediately made me a new kebab and offered me the rice with lentils which like I mention before it was delicious. We really enjoyed eating here and we will be back for more. I would have posted a pic but I was hangry lol
author: Fern D.

description: I am so mad at myself for living here a year and a half without stopping in here for lunch. So delicious! So friendly! This place should be packed all the time. Definitely come here.
author: Dan W.

description:
Came here for a quick bite with my friend because we saw it randomly empty. I ended up getting the vegetarian plate which was pretty filling. I had to take about half home. My friend got the shawarma wrap and she also took half back. The food was good. I didn't really like one of the hummus on the plate but I forgot which one it was. 

The people are nice! The food pretty quick and easy. It costs about 10 bucks which isn't bad for SF food. Glad I got my one dollar employee discount :). 

Honestly probably wouldn't come back again specifically for the food. Maybe for a casual lunch or something.
author: Akash P.

description: The falafel wrap + hummus was delicious. The wrap was hefty -- filled with moist falafel, hot sauce, pickles, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Comparable to that of Truly Mediterranean, with the added bonus of seating.
author: Camille E.

description: Delicious food and delightful service!  This is a family-run place with yummy middle Eastern food made from scratch.  Everyone who works there is super nice and we highly recommend it for a casual meal.
author: Chris K.

description: Excellent Mediterranean restaurant near UC Med Center. I will definitely be back. The food was hot, fresh and very tasty. I tried the lamb-beef Schwarma with rice, hummus, and falafel. They also provided a generous portion of fresh pita bread. Inside and outside seating.
author: John G.

description: Love this little neighborhood spot. Great middle eastern food for great prices. Portions are very generous. Similar to Palmyra in the Haight. I love their vegetarian platter, it's slightly different from the one in Palmyra but also very delicious. Their baba ganouj is on the smokier side. I just wish they were opened on Sunday!
author: Luba Y.

description:
I'm writing this review half an hour (correction - 4 days) after finishing up their chicken shawarma wrap.

I've 2 favorite Mediterranean spots:-
1. Yumma in inner sunset
2. Old Jerusalem in outer mission

This place doesn't even come close to them. I took the order to-go but the pita bread was just warm and the chicken was chewy. Gave me a heartburn after an hour or so.

On a positive note, friendly and quick service!
author: G B.

description: Great food, very clean and exremely friendly service.  Five of us visited for the first time and we all share this sentiment.   Will be back and highly recommend it to everyone.
author: Vahid G.

description: One of my favorite go to places in the city. They are polite and sweet. The food is exactly as I like it, and consistently delicious. My go to if is for the veg combo plate, and I sub out the dolmas. Happy every time. With Their lunch portion I take some to go to have later. As a UCSF employee you get 10% off which is a nice touch
author: Michelle D.

description: I always love this place... I work 5 days a week and would go for a 2 to 3 times a week lunch at this place. They gives you a discount if your UCSF employee.
author: Ruthie C.

description: Taboun has the best Middle Eastern food! The falafel is the right amount of crispy/moist. My favorites are their baba ganoush, dolmas, and mojadara. Always tasty. They also do a nice job on catering.
author: Anne T.

description: Best falafel in town. Large portions good value. Nice selection of beverages, alcoholic and non-alcoholic, good atmosphere, friendly service. Nice neighborhood.
author: Hugh M.

description:
I can't say this is my favorite Mediterranean food place ever, but if you're in the neighborhood looking for something yum and filling, Taboun is a great option.

The wraps are massive so you'll definitely be getting your money's worth.  I tried the eggplant without hot sauce just because I'm a pansy, but I'm fairly sure the hot sauce makes their wraps taste better.  The outer layer of pita was burnt so my wrap tasted overwhelmingly charry, but I enjoyed the flavor of the filling and the texture of the grilled eggplant enough that I wouldn't mind ordering the same thing again.

There was a group of us waiting for our to-go orders and even though it didn't even take that long, the kind man making our wraps also gave us a whole bag of fresh falafels!  What a sweetie!!!  I ate mine so fast I forgot to take a picture, but they were were lovely, albeit dry.  Still, I definitely recommend the falafel!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Delicious! I ordered the Lamb Beef Shawerma with a side of Hummus and Baba Ghanouj as take-out. It was ready on time, well-packaged, and was super tasty! I will be returning for sure.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The Deluxe falafel wrap was alright. The eggplant and potatoes added were not as savory as I expected. 

If you're looking for veggie options around ucsf, this place is convenient.
author: Rachel C.

description: Good wraps can be found here at an affordable price point, and the service is quick and friendly. I'd recommend grabbing the Lamb Shish Kebab.
author: Chet A.

description: My cousin took me here on Wednesday evening. He lives right across from it and it would have been nice to have known about this place earlier. But now I do and will most likely be getting food from here again. I got the chicken shawarma, which I annihilated. It was really tasty and had the right balance of meat and veggies. I wish the hot sauce had more kick, but still good nonetheless.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Pretty basic setup but the food is delicious.

My fav is the veggi platter. The hummus is excellent and the felafel are crispy and tasty!
author: Erica S.

description:
I came here yesterday, by the recommendation of a friend I was with.

Glad I did, as I had been craving this type of mediterranean food for a while.


Nice clean, family run shop, with great food, very reasonable prices for SF.

I got the falafel delux wrapped in shawarma, and I must say it was excellent, and big portion too.  I really like how this delux version included eggplant & potato inside of the Shawarma.. mm!

I liked it so much, I ended up buying 2 lamb & beef shwarma wraps for our dinner that night too!

I probably wouldn't come all the way to SF JUST to eat here... but if I was close enough in SF, I wouldn't hesitate to stop by, and grab some falafels or a wrap.
author: Eli G.

description: I love this place, so warm and good vibes in the middle of the city, really nice people and the price is fine, but let's talk about the food.....! Delicious!! Fresh! So tasty! Perfect place to open the day!
author: Aviv M.

description:
Finally tried Taboun after driving past it so many times. I got a chicken shawarma with hot sauce and my boyfriend got the lamb and beef shawarma with no hot sauce. Both wraps were huge and savory, but I preferred the lamb and beef over the chicken. The hot sauce was delicious, though. It added a nice flavor without being overpowering. Wraps are affordable and location is nice-- right next to UCSF and I think UCSF employees get 10% off! 
Would definitely recommend :)
author: Jen W.

description: Lamb and beef shawarma, need I say more? My wife found this little place last year. We happened to be in San Francisco again so we made a point to go here. It appears to be a family business, and offers shawarma, falafel, dolmas, deliciously creamy hummus, babaganouche, and lots more. I love the hole in the wall, nicely decorated aesthetic, and the folks who work here are great. Service was fast, food was hot and yummy, I highly recommend Taboun!.
author: M W.

description:
Lamb-Beef or Chicken Shawerma Wraps are now $8.75 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6ZrEklsw3WiASAUq_2DZcQ?select=yhpJkofL-dmDW-_I3ehL6A) up from $6.95 in the ourdated 2007 menu picture. For +$3 you can "Plate your wrap" which means 2 sides (dolma, falafel, hummus, etc) & pita.

I got the lamb-beef wrap "plated" with dolma & falafel (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6ZrEklsw3WiASAUq_2DZcQ?select=WPkYoNFyuxk84yNwp7BgyA). With the added pita I probably should have made hummus one of the sides.

There was a good amount of flavorful meat in the wrap along with tahini and some cucumber / tomato salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6ZrEklsw3WiASAUq_2DZcQ?select=lTcnJzqSuq1oqrHKs9GvDw), but the meat was pretty dry. It may have been because I was the first customer of the day and getting somewhat "twice-cooked" meat from the outside of the vertical skewer. Also, the wrap was grilled too much after assembly making the lavash super brittle. It was cracking quickly and leaking / falling apart. Not fun eats.

On the plus side the freshly cooked falafel was moist and well seasoned. It looked like the cook them in batches and not to order so being one of the first customers of the day was better for the falafel.

The pita wedges provided were thin and nothing special. The dolmas were good, but not exceptional.
author: Andrew C.

description: I ordered the vegetarian combo which it was good. My friend ordered the lamb beef shawirma dinner and the meat was hard and dry, and I tasted it, not worth it. He ended up left mostly untouched.
author: Ken W.

description: decent food, satisfied by hungry tummy.  Owner family were all very nice! They had own this place for 11+ years.. I will return!! ;)
author: Jasmin Y.

description: Great lunch stop if you are on Parnassus in Cole Valley or UCSF.  We found the beef/lamb shawarma to be very tasty.  Service is fast and pleasant and personal.  Best side dish IMHO is the smoky baba ghanoush.  Yum!  The portions are good sized, and my cucumber/tomato/feta salad was very fresh.
author: Suzanne M.

description: Walked by several times on my way to UCSF. Always folks here. First time tonight, again five or so folks ordering to gLamb dinner over rice. Two sides (humus & falafel) with pita. Delicious, fast, very friendly and well priced! -10% for UCSF folks with badge.
author: Ivy Z.

description: Super affordable, large portions, excellent presentation, amazing taste. Highly recommend.
author: Scott S.

description:
I moved to the neighborhood fairly recently, and was delighted to see a restaurant so close by (feet away, really). We tried it on our first night in the neighborhood and it completely exceeded my expectations.

For context, I lived in the Middle East, so I am always a bit let down about Middle Eastern restaurants in the US. But this place is really so spot on. All of the food is fresh, the portions are enormous (I can stretch one order for three meals) and the service is super quick and friendly. I now have to stop myself from eating here every day :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
All in all: Dont go here. 

Food bland, fries soggy, overpriced for mediocre cooking.

There are too many GOOD restaurants in the city that you don't have to settle to eat here. I always, always, always recommend everyone to go to Palmyra in Lower Haight. Places like Taboun are the reason why some Mediterranean food gets a bad rap. 

Conclusion: I guess if you like shitty food, have no sense of flavor and like paying over price for it... then this is place for you. For everyone else in this city that knows better, dont waste your time or money.
author: Julia D.

description: Friendly staff, great food, fair prices, and a cozy atmosphere. In definitely coming back soon
author: Ramy S.

description: We have been going to Taboun since 2007. It is still as great as it always was. By now they know everything we are going to order when I call to place it. People are nice, place is still clean, food is still great. Highly recommend to anyone.
author: Sophie N.

description:
I usually order catering. A small vegetarian platter and several chicken kabobs on the side. It comes with plenty of pita bread. The chicken kabobs were really good. Seasoned wella and juicy. They separate it from the veggie platter.

I went once for lunch and ordered a chicken kabob wrap. I think I'd prefer it on a plate and wish the wrap came with hummus. The wrap itself was sort of dry until you get to the juicy meat or sauce. 

Overall, I'd order their veggie platter, but probably wouldn't come here for lunch again.
author: Christina L.

description: Amazing food, the people amazing and really nice, I want to thanks them for a dream who came true to east reall Israeli food
author: Eli M.

description:
My wife and I have been going to Taboun for years, ever since we moved into Cole Valley when she started medical school.  The food has always been great, and Maurice and his family are very friendly.

This past weekend, we had a party in Golden Gate Park and needed catering.  Who better to turn to than our friends at Taboun?  They provided us veggie platters that went above and beyond.  We had plenty of food and then some thanks to the heaping platters from the Taboun team, and our guests raved about the tastiness.  And the beautiful flowers from their shop next door gave a nice extra touch to our GG Park picnic.

Thank you Taboun!
-Andrew & Kate
author: Andrew H.

description: Love the shawarma here. Perfect place for people living in inner sunset or cole valley near UCSF. Quick food and great. Quiet place.
author: Mitch C.

description: Best shawerma in town, they do it the right way when u go their make sure u ask for the Ramallah style lamb shawerma and that's how it should be
author: Nate K.

description:
Was staying in the area because my son was under going surgery and walked by this place and wanted to try it.  Soooooooo glad I did!! 

The food was great and is very close to ucsf.  Have eaten there three times in three days!!
author: Steve V.

description:
No flavors at all in the falafel I had. On top of this, mine had pickles in it- which I've never had in any mediterranean food before. The flavors were also lacking in the side dishes as well (the creamy eggplant (baba ganoush?) and tabouli). Why would anyone go there is beyond me, but look for better more authentic options than this one. 

Also, at 8pm there was no one inside eating- no one. If this isn't a sign that you're not getting enough business, then I don't know what else is.
author: Carolina S.

description: If you're not too hungry, get the chicken shish kabab plate and share it with a friend! It comes with your choice of two sides (I like their baba ganoush), and pita bread -- a generous portion to split. I'll be back to try the lamb and kefta kababs soon.
author: Linda Y.

description:
This place gets three stars almost automatically, for being within walking distance of UCSF.   It's hard to find shawarma, sometimes, and at this place it's definitely passable.

The sides were decent, good dolma, great babaganoush.  The tabouli was interesting, but good.   The shawarma (lamb and beef) was a little dry but flavorful.   I won't turn this place down next time I'm at UCSF with a gyro craving.
author: Benjamin E.

description: Great for the UCSF and local crowd around cole valley. The food is fresh.  The humus is awesome.  My favorite is the Chicken Shawirma Dinner Plate, the chicken is tasty, plus the 2 side dishes, even 2 people can share if you are not big eaters.
author: Tony T.

description: I love this place. I've had almost everything on the menu and never been disappointed. In fact The owner, Maurice, is one of the most personable patrons in the city.  And his food is outstanding.  If you are a fan of eggplant, you have to try it here.  The hummus is excellent ... so creamy.  And the mojadara is an tasty addition to any combination of foods.
author: Alex J.

description: I got the falafel and it was very good. It was fresh, tasty, and the salads added a nice variety and crunch. A bit salty but not overdressed; I liked that the last part of the sandwich was not a wet mess. Very nice people.
author: Robert T.

description: This place is ridiculously good. The lamb/beef shawerma wrap is huge, the flavor is perfect and the lavash is fresh and the perfect texture. The dolmas are excellent, grape leaves not too bitter and the rice veggie mix is spiced perfectly. Staff is friendly, and the location is clean. Handicap accessible restroom for customers. Didn't have the falafel, but another person here was eating it and said it was amazing. If you're stuck at UCSF and need a place to get great food, large portions at a reasonable price, I can't recommend this enough. Top notch, fast and delicious.
author: Micheal S.

description:
I like this place. It is very clean and the quality of their ingredients are very good. 
Try the beef shawarma wrap. 4 star for lack of parking has nothing to do with food.
author: MOREY D.

description: My favorites are the deluxe falafel wrap and the chicken shawarma wrap. So fresh, delicious and consistent.
author: J J.

description:
Avoid. This place is horrible. I don't know why people keep saying, "It's good if you're on your way somewhere and need some Mediterranean food." OK:

A.) Where the hell are you going?
B.) Why in San Francisco would you ever need to settle on picking a specific type of cuisine? There's so much variety in this city, if you're not near a Mediterranean restaurant then opt for something different.

I walked in and instantly knew this was a mistake because it was 12:30 and I was the only person in the restaurant. I ordered my chicken shawarma plate with dolma and hummus. The cashier  mumbled something about spicy so I said "yea, sure." Ugh. 

First of all, my shawarma was disgusting; who puts pickles and pickled vegetables in a shawarma? It was so gross and watery. Did anyone even think about what they were assembling with this? I couldn't even finish it (which is unheard of with me); I got 2 dolma with my meal (whoa, slow down there) and a scoop of hummus. The dolma were OK but there were only two of them. The hummus? Congratulations, you smashed chick peas and added olive oil. Where was the spicy factor, by the way? Never found it.

As I left the restaurant no one said "thank you," "bye" or anything. Rude customer service and not to mention how outrageously expensive it was. Go somewhere else. Anywhere, really.
author: Tommy C.

description: Really enjoyed my meal, the hummus is so creamy and has great flavor and my wrap was big and pack full of meat and veggies highly recomend
author: Karen G.

description:
Pretty good falafel wrap and beef wrap. 

However, the service was really slow. It seemed a lot slower b/c we were hungry too. We were the only customer in there for the first 5 minutes, and this was around 11:30am. We didn't get our food until 15 minutes later. Perhaps, the restaurant wasn't ready for us?
author: Jen H.

description:
Came in on a Wednesday Evening for a falafel wrap - and was thoroughly disappointed with the quality of the wrap compared to King of Falafel, Opa Market and many others in SF.

Overall a serviceable wrap but nothing out of this world.
author: Brian D.

description: Stopped into this little joint hungry from hiking the Mt. Sutro trails. Their "falafel deluxe" wrap, which adds eggplant and potatoes to the standard falafel, was delicious! It's served on hot lavash bread bordering on crispy, which was a notch above the soggy wraps I'm unfortunately used to. Honestly I'm kind of astonished to get food of this quality at such a good price. Friendly staff and well-decorated place too. Will be back.
author: Scott F.

description: Just a short walk from the UCSF Parnassus campus is this Mediterranean gem! I ordered the Vegetarian plate, which was a sampler of dips, salads, falafel balls, dolma and pita bread. This was a lot of food for lunch but I ended up sharing some of it. Plus, UCSF ID's get you 10% off :) Will definitely be back for the fresh, delicious food and fast, friendly service!
author: Amanda H.

description: Food was good, service could certainly be friendlier. I kinda felt like I barged into someone's home, uninvited.
author: Nina M.

description:
Worst Mediterranean food I have had in a long time. Would not recommend eating here. I have no clue why people write good reviews on this place.

* Falafel wrap had pickles and french fries in them. Pickles? McDonald's style pickles in the wrap. French fries? Soggy bulk warehouse store fries with no flavor. Falafel was too spicy to taste other flavors in the wrap.
* Our order was to go, so our dolmas were wrapped in aluminum foil. Who likes smashed dolmas? We didn't.

Overall, I have to say this place caters to the average, uneducated, American palate. If you like Medi food, avoid this place. There's a better place on Haight and Pierce just down in the Lower Haight.

Avoid at all costs.
author: D M.

description:
Taboun is a solid place to grab a quick lunch or dinner if you're on the way to somewhere. 

I always get the lamb/beef or chicken shawarma wrap, ask for it spicy to add a little extra flavor. The hummus and baba ghanoush do look pretty good as well but since I always get Taboun when I'm on the go I haven't tried them yet. 

It always seems like it takes them longer to make the food than it should, but even then it's pretty fast so I can't really complain.

The wraps are LARGE and reasonably priced, the connivence of this places for me helps as well. If you're in the area and you want a shawarma wrap on the go, this is your answer.
author: Ely L.

description: Delicious food! The shwarmas are amazing as are the falafel, veggie plate, and hummus, potatoes (French fries), etc. The people who work there are amazing and make incredibly tasty food. Must try, I have been coming back since it opened!!!!!!
author: David W.

description: Had a falafel wrap yesterday it was pretty yummy and my god! it was a pretty big wrap almost the size of a super burrito. I will definitely be going back especially since it is conveniently located right down the street from the UCSF campus and the service was fast and friendly.
author: Claudia R.

description: We got Taboun to cater an event. The owner, Maurice, is extremely nice. The food was delicious...really good hummus and wraps. Best falafals I've had in the city. I'd say the only issue was that the baklava was excellent but extremely pricey.
author: Sofia M.

description: Decent place to grab a quick lunch if you're in the area. The owners are friendly, prices are fair, and portions are pretty big. I've only tried the lamb-beef shawarma and chicken shawarma so far. I liked the lamb-beef, but the chicken one was slightly bland. They don't skimp on the portions though - the shawarma is loaded with meat and veggies! You're also given the option of hot sauce with your shawarma - I asked for it on the side with my to-go order, but sadly didn't find it in my bag when I finally sat down to eat. I was also a little disappointed with my shawarma this time because it was super soggy and wet on the bottom after only 20 minutes. :(
author: Stephanie G.

description: Delicious and full of flavor,  quality meats, dolmas for .50 and wraps can feed you for two meals!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Not sure if it was just an off-day or maybe they were insulted that I asked for Tzatziki on my kebab but these guys didn't like me for some reason and the kebab was bad. 

A chicken kebab was 10.31 (with optional fries added in the wrap for .75)! That to me is pretty damn steep for a kebab - especially for the quality which I received. It was bland even after I asked for extra spicy. 

The service was poor. The prices were high. I don't plan on ever going back.
author: Eli L.

description: Best falafel in town. Pick up six perfectly crispy yet moist on the inside little nuggets for only THREE dollars and pat yourself on the back. Service is always great the guys there are wonderful. Five stars. my favorite
author: James W.

description:
This is our go-to spot for Shwarma in the City.  The lamb-beef shwarma is delicious - juicy, tender, flavorful meat shredded into tiny morsels and served over rice for the dinner plate, and in a wrap otherwise.  The sides are decent too - we particularly like the mojadara, a blend of rice, lentils and carmelized onions.   My toddler reports that the chicken shwarma is yummy as well, though because it's a mix of white and dark meat I don't like it as much.

Usually not too crowded and a great place to take ankle biters - they have high chairs and it's very casual so nobody minds the clamor.   Order at the counter and they'll bring it to your table - great for take-out too.  Big servings, reasonable prices - no complaints here.
author: Katy M.

description:
Plates are good but wraps are dryyyy. Hummus is very good.  I often go just to get the hummus, which is a lot better than store-bought.

Support your locals!
author: Ang F.

description: The lamb-beef shawarma that I had was very good and I'd for sure get it again, but just note that the prices have gone up since the pic provided of the menu (that was uploaded in Aug. '07); it's now $8.95, or $9.58 w/tax included.  It is a little pricey, especially for lunch - but taste-wise, it makes up for it and you could very well eat half of it for later!  The interior is nice - very calm and relaxed looking.  After I placed my order, it took around 5min to receive it and there were about four other people already eating there during the time I went, sometime after 12pm.  The people working there were nice and gave good service.  I really liked having the hot sauce in the shawarma - to me it had just the right kick to it, and made it even more delicious!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
For a Cole Valley restaurant this place is fairly affordable--a little more on the expensive side of reasonable (much like most of the neighborhood). However, I do really like their wraps. Though not the best Mediterranean place in San Francisco I have to say that they're not bad--the pickles suck, but other than that I really like their deluxe felafel wrap is pretty delicious. And for what you'd get for the same prices at a lot of other local joints I'd have to conclude that you'll get a pretty healthy serving here. 

In conclusion, their better than average but not much. I'll keep eating here regularly just for their wraps and the convenience.
author: Brandon R.

description:
Conveniently located right down the street from the UCSF campus, this is the ultimate quick, comfort food.

Chicken skewers are nicely charred outside but so moist and flavorful inside.  Beef kebabs are done equally well.  Grilled tomatoes are slightly smoky but sweet, beef is not dried out.  The falafel is fried perfectly but not too greasy, and it's probably my favorite thing here.  

Hummus is standard, but the baba ganouj was a little too oily and not as smoky as I'd like.  Other typical things I tried were the tabouleh, mojadara, Greek salad, dolmas, but nothing stood out too much.

Most people I saw were getting shawaramas, I guess because they're portable and filling, but do NOT miss out on the falafel!
author: Marilyn H.

description:
This place is super friendly and the overall taste is nice as well. I had the chicken shwarma and it beat out Blue Front IMO. My friend has a gluten allergy and they adjusted their plate to fit her needs. They also came outside to double check to make sure that she was allergic to other ingredients. 

I have only been here once, but I would go back for sure! I will have to say that I prefer a much strong tzatziki sauce, if I had to complain. 

Food: Fresh and plentiful 
Service: Fast and friendly 
Price: Very Reasonable 

Seating: not a ton, but can accommodate some.
author: Kat M.

description:
I may be biased, because this is just steps from my front door ... But I like this place. 

It's a little pricy in my opinion, but the food quality is pretty good. They're also fast - I've never waited more than 5-10 minutes. 

Try the falafel wrap with hot sauce. I'm hooked!
author: Andrew H.

description: Microwaved pita and old babaganush.  Way to impress a first time costumer...Not going back.
author: josh d.

description: I had a falafel and the falafel pieces themselves were cold.   Not room temperature; cold.   I complained to the cook that my falafel was cold and was told "we don't cook them for each order; they're pre-cooked."  Fine, but at least warm  them up.   No; he didn't offer to warm up the food, apparently didn't see a problem.   Besides that, their food is consistently over-salted, which may not matter to everybody, but it does to me.    I won't be back.
author: Richard R.

description:
The interior is pretty adorable. We came here for lunch and ordered the chicken shawerma wrap and the deluxe falafel wrap. The chicken tasted grilled and was the highlight of the wrap. The deluxe falafel wrap was decent but lacking in kick, and the falafel was a little dry.

Kind of expensive--two wraps + two pieces of falafel + two beers = $30. The beer selection was decent, though.
author: Dante and Alleliah G.

description: Wow, I was surprised on how good this place turned out to be. Ive been here twice already and the food was consistently good both times. The first time I got the chicken shawirma, I plated the order which means you get two sides with it for 3 bucks extra. The shawirma was really juicy and full of flavor. I got hummus and falafel as the sides. The humus was super good, nice and creamy with a good flavor. The falafel was great as well, crispy layer, and soft and warm in the inside. The second time I came here I got the beef shawirma and also plated my wrap. This was probably my favorite shawimra, very juicy and and the flavors just burst in my mouth. This time I got Tabuli and taboun salad. The tabuli was super fresh and just had the right amount of lemon juice and olive oil. The taboun salad was also a super zesty and yummy salad. I plan on coming here again, this time I wanna try the dinner plates and veggie combo. I would honestly recommend this place to any body. It has great options for all, for meat lovers and for vegetarians and vegans. And its very healthy as well!
author: Mark S.

description:
I have been eyeing this place for a while because I love Mediterranean food and I finally made it there this month. I have been twice and had the falafel deluxe wrap which very big and very delicious. This might have been because I was starving the first time.

I saw them making Mojadara with meat on top (+$3), so I got that the second time. It was okay.. the meat seemed a bit dry ... maybe it wasn't fresh because its the end of the weekend?  I tried my friend's hummus and babganoush- good, but wasn't the best I ever had. They did grill the tomatoes and onions when I added them to add that. 

Overall, I think I will go there again just for good measure so I can see what the food is like during working hours and has just been made. And maybe I will check against the other mediterrean place around Iriving and 7th (which never fails me!!)
author: Sirina K.

description: The hummus and falafel are truly amazing! I love that they will let you customize the vegetarian platter, too!  They are also very accommodating if you have a large order, although the they prefer advance notice since they are a small restaurant.
author: A.L. W.

description:
Drove pass by on Monday night as I had to drop off a prescription at the Walgreen's down the block. 

I ordered the lamb & beef shawarma (7.95). I was surprised at the generous amount of meat in the shawarma. The only thing was the middle was little cold, and the lavash wasn't really toasted. Other than than, it was pretty good. But, not as good as Truly Mediterranean.

If I'm ever in the area, I would give it another try.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I LOVE this place. Their Vegetarian combo is excellent... big portions and they always let me substitute items on the combo that I don't like with veggie items I do like. Great quality of food, fairly priced, and good portion size = AWESOME :)
author: Shruti K.

description: For Cole Valley residents, Taboun is a convenient and perfectly fine place for middle eastern cuisine.  The falafel is the highlight here, and the hummus, baba ghanoush, and tahini are tasty too.  The lamb and chicken kebabs, though flavorful, tend to be slightly dry and tough.  Nonetheless, Taboun provides reliably quick service, and affordable and satisfying food in a bright and tidy setting.
author: Chris T.

description:
I found this place after looking foe something other than hospital food while my wife was @ UCSF for 2 weeks and just a few blocks down the hill from there. 
This was my first time there and employees took their time to explain the menu. I ordered the Lamb/Beef Shawirma, $7.95 and Hummus $4.25. Very good meal, good flavors and a fair price.  Food got cold by the time I finished in 8 minutes, but wouldn't hold that against them, because even cold the Shawirma still held good flavors.

Selections of beer, soda, and wine is very small, but they have the basics covered. 

I would go back and looking forward to the Chicken Shawirma and will review that one too. I'll try to attach a current menu with new prices.

Semper Fi
author: TERRY K.

description:
Mmmmm... Shawirma....mmmm

I have to admit that I only ever order one thing here, the Chicken Shawirma! I'm not usually the kind of person to order the same thing every time, but it is so good. And honestly, there are some days where I just crave one of their flavorful shawirma wraps.  It is the perfect meal on the go, and on a nice day it is fantastic to sit on the corner, watch the world go by and enjoy some really yummy food.
author: Krystal W.

description: Excellent shawarma wraps and platters! Lamb here is very tender. Highly recommend adding the hot sauce to the dishes. If going with a group, order a basket of falafels for the table (tasty appetizer!). Friendly service. No complaints!
author: Rohan W.

description:
Well, I don't normally eat Mediterranean food, but I had food from this place once, when my mentor decided to buy everyone in my lab lunch from this place.

My very first experience with a falafel wasn't very good. It was dry and not great. But when I ate a falafel from here...I fell in love with them. It was so good.  We ordered a vegetarian platter, with a bunch of stuff on it. There was mojadara (which was one of my faves), taboun salad, hummus, tabouleh, and some other things too. The main stuff i ate on the platter was the falafel, mojadara, pita bread, and the hummus. It was really good, and really filling. After eating, I was so sleepy.
author: Breniel L.

description: Delicious. Hearty. Great prices. Great people. Love this place!
author: Maria L.

description:
What a nice little place!

I've had all the worst varieties of falafel and was pleasantly surprised when I tried the falafel wrap.  The dining room is small and casual, and the staff appreciates if you bus your table after eating.

The staff was very friendly and the food arrived quickly.
author: Em S.

description:
Come on, Taboun... I just got a falafel wrap, and the lavash is about 6 layers thick, basically giving something that tastes like a cracker the consistency of soggy cardboard.  (Did you know lavash means "cracker bread"?  thanks Wikipedia) I have to bite through it to get the GOOD stuff on the inside, which only makes up about a third of the wrap.  Yuck.

FYI:  you guys CAN put the amazing falafel you make IN the amazing pita you also make.  and no, you don't have to wrap it up and put it on a grill!  You just serve it that way - if it's to go, wrap it gently --  but not like a burrito...  


Ugh.  I really want to drop a star here but they still have some of the best falafel in SF, and good options aside from the wraps (e.g. veggie combo).  So they deserve 4, I guess.  But this wrap deserves a 1.
author: Danna G.

description: Good shawarma plates, very mediocre wraps. Slightly overpriced
author: trevor j.

description:
I usually am prejudiced against food from the Middle East due to bad experiences in the past and how "exotic" it is compared to the Asian foods I usually eat. But after following a recommendation from a friend, this place totally changed my mind ...

My wife and I usually order takeout from here every few weeks since the restaraunt is kinda small to eat at. We usually get the Chicken Shawirma with the tomato, cucumber salad, pita with hummus, and rice/lentils. All I gotta say is mmm mmmm delish!

Give it a try. You won't be disappointed!
author: Daniel L.

description:
I don't get why this place has such good reviews. My friend and I had the falafel wrap and chicken shawarma. I found the chicken to be rather tasteless.

Good shawarma has flavorful chicken. Chicken on a spit requires a bit of fat in order to truly bring out any flavor.The spits at Taboun were bone dry.

Perhaps this is just how this place interprets how a shawarma should be made. In which case, my quest for a juicy, nicely charred shawarma  continues.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Very decent Mediterranean food. I always go for a wrap with two sides. The latter are always fresh and tasty.

The place and very clean and well maintained. Pretty rare in the city .


I just wonder why they don't seem to have very good business.
author: Anastasia M.

description:
Somehow, I've lived three blocks from this restaurant for over a year and never knew it was there, but I woke up Saturday morning craving falafel, so I got my first taste of Taboun.

Not liking the looks of the shawerma meat rotating on the spits, I ordered the vegetarian platter.  The man who took my order informed me before taking my money that it would take about ten minutes and I had my food in about 8.  I assume it was because I was the first customer of the day and they were still warming up, but nonetheless, I thought that offering the warning was kind.  

I took my food to go, but the inside of the restaurant was very clean and well-maintained, if not rather small and characterless. 

The platter was loaded with a superb selection of dolmas, salad, feta, pickles, tabbouleh, hummus, baba ganoush, and falafel.  There was an adequate amount of toasted pita wrapped in foil and everything was superb with the exception of the baba ganoush, which had a little bit of an off taste, but it wasn't awful. For eight bucks, it was a substantial amount of food.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Best falafel place in the city!  Good portions and low prices, plus they give you pickle and onion!  They have the best free water, too, made out of mint and cucumbers.

Falafel:  5 stars
Tabouli:  4 stars
Lamb:  5 stars
Hummus:  5 stars
Veggies:  5 stars
Customer service:  4 stars
Prices:  5 stars
Hours of operation:  5 stars
Parking:  3 stars

Overall:  5 stars

Note:  They are always willing to substitute.  For example, I don't eat dolmas or pita bread, so they give me extra falafel.
author: Dicky V.

description: Based on my experience today, Taboun gets 1 star. Usually I love the chicken Shwarma and Fallafel. Tonight the Shwarma was completely bland and tasteless. This is the first time I have such bland food at this restaurant. I hope the food gets back to the good stuff they have had in the past. I will try it again but hope to not have a repeat of tonight.
author: Shannon P.

description:
When a "side" of hummus is as big as a boat I couldn't be happier. 

I could swim in hummus!  Especially THIS hummus...damn it was good. 

Super friendly people, too.  Any place that has chicken and hummus definitely warrants a return visit.  

It has a cute little seating area, too.
author: Jay H.

description:
This place is nice and very close to work (UCSF Parnassus). I had a spicy beef-lamb shwarma wrap, some falafel and hummus. It ended up being two meals worth of food. The falafel were flavorful and crispy. The hummus was creamy and tahini-i. The shwarma meat was tender and really flavorful. For the price, it was way worth it. And I can take muni back and forth. I will definitely return for some lunchtime fare! 

Oh btw, they usually have wrap specials (e.g., falafel wrap for $5.95) on a daily basis.
author: Jess V.

description: We just moved up the street and frankly, haven't met a single neighbor who was even polite. Feeling a little remorseful after moving here, we all (housemates) walked down to Taboun. Maurice from next door told us to check it out cause these are the same owners. We walk in to a clean, and beautiful counter with murals covering the walls and a huge menu to choose from. We had a falafel deluxe, a veggie platter, and the steak and chicken skewer plate. The food was just what we needed! Affordable, fast, and DELICIOUS! Hit the jackpot here. Now it's our favorite place to grab on the way home! The on;y thing that sucked, was they were out of the taboulie salad I was looking for, so my veggie plate was a TON of hummus and not much extra. Still my new favorite falafel place!
author: Jena D.

description:
1)  YUMMY (i ordered the deluxe falafel  which was NOT greasy &  shared the hummmm...mmus, which was really really good)
2)  Great alternative to other eateries near UCSF
3)  CLEAN CLEAN restaurant
4)  FAST Service
5)  Love supporting local businesses

my co-worker and I were pleasantly surprised and are going to return very very soon.
author: Stel D.

description:
Great place for falafel! 

They have a great menu, tasty dishes and fast friendly service.  My boyfriend shared the chicken schwarma dinner plate.  There was more than enough food for both of us and we were stuffed after.

One of my favorite places for lunch.
author: Christy L.

description: We loved the food! I had the veggie sampler and my friend had lamb kabobs. Both were fabulous. Wish I was a local, I'd be back for lunches and take out.
author: Michelle G.

description:
They make a mean shawerma at Taboun, but I think the vegetarian plate is really the best bargain in the house. For like 7 dollars you get massive piles of hummus, babaganoush, tabouleh, dolmas, cheese, pickles, olives, falafel, greek salad, and toasty warm pita. If you're really hungry, it's enough to eat 2/3 of. If you're only averagely hungry, its enough to eat half today and save half for lunch tomorrow.  

Two other high points. . . as others have said, the place is always sparkling clean, and they make the free non-bottled water obvious and available and its always fresh-tasting from the cucumber slices floating in it.
author: Julia G.

description:
I've had the veg/falafel and the lamb-beef shawirmas (spelled this way on their menu), shared the Greek salad and veg combo. Only the Veg combo and Veg Shawirma were really good, because they were fresh and flavorful. The Greek salad was OK, but the lamb shawirma was tasteless; today the meat was old (not cut from the vertical rotisserie) and tough. Shawirma + coke +$9.44 incl tax, so it was no bargain.
They serve a large portion of food, but it seemed even larger because I struggled a bit to finish the bland mass. The restaurant is clean, but this is not a plus, this is a basic expectation. The pickles surprised me, too. It was OK, but I would rather forgo the experience,
author: YearOf M.

description: now that we are getting arabic style on pita , this place has the number one shawarma in city , hands down ( THE BEST )
author: NAEL K.

description:
I am so happy this is my neighborhood falafel joint!  I mean how can you argue with french fries in your falafel????  It doesn't get better.

Also, their hummus is REALLY, REALLY, REALLY good.  Besides the deluxe falafel (with the fries inside), I also love picking up a takeout order of a dozen falafel (only $3.95 and they will make them fresh for you!), some hummus and pita bread.  It is the perfect treat for a picnic.  Your friends will love you!
author: Melissa M.

description:
My colleague raved about Taboun after eating there on a recent
foray to her doc on Parnassus.  Of course, her tantalizing descriptions game shortly before lunch time and it wasn't long before we were
online and perusing the menu.  I ended up choosing enough food to 
last the entire President's holiday weekend!

Not ever having set foot in the place, all I know is that I am delighted
with the food itself.  The portions are huge and my wallet still has
spending money left.  I havent tried everything yet but, what I've eaten
thus far, is superb.  The falafel is the best I've eaten in thirty years of
living in San Francisco!  Normally, I find it so hard that it could be a
lethal weapon if catapulted from a sling shot!  Not so that of Taboun.  It was perfect.  And the Baba Ghanouj, with its creamy, smoky taste, amply laden with what seemed dozens of cloves of garlic ( never enough for me ) had me licking my lips.  The pita bread was delicious...don't know if they make their own but they sent quite a bit with the extra Baba Ghanouj I ordered.  I also had their lamb shish
kebab - wonderfully succulent pieces of lamb!  

For later, I have their Vegetarian Combo ( I'm on call at 11PM and it will hit the spot if my pager goes off in the wee small hours though I'll have to gargle mouthwash all the way to the hospital ) - hummus, baba ghanouj,  tabouleh, taboun salad falafel balls, dolmas, feta cheese, onion and pita bread.

I'll certainly have to find more reasons to head over Parnassus way -
most of my doctors are at CPMC!
author: Carmen H.

description:
I live near Taboun and that is the only reason I come here, although it is not bad. I have had lots of middle eastern food and this place is rather average (though not greasy, which is good!). I have tried most things here and nothing is quite good enough to be a favorite. I have multiple complaints about Taboun.

The food is not very consistent. Sometimes it tastes really good, sometime it is cold, less flavorful and undercooked. Oftentimes when you order falafel they give you cold ones that were cooked awhile ago. If you get a wrap that has their large french fries in it, they put in really cold and soggy old fries as opposed to fresh ones. The meats tend to be dry  and spend variable amounts of time being cooked on the stove vs. turning grill (I can't think of the correct name for that right now). In general, I just think this place is inconsistent and as I said in the beginning... if I moved I would not miss this place, but because it is so convenient, I remain a consistent patron.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have been a long time neighbor and customer here.  The food is usually good and a great value.  

My one gripe with it is that sometimes the falafels are cold by the time you eat them.  The textures aren't the most appetizing. 

I thought I would counter-act this by asking if they could heat up the fries before they put them in my deluxe falafel...  and the answer---  "No, that's the way we do it."  me, "But sometimes the falafel is really cold in the middle and I prefer it hot.",  him, "No, that's how we do it.", me, "Ok, I will go somewhere else."

I work in the food service industry, losing a customer because you don't want to drop a few fries in hot oil before you serve it to them...  ridiculous.
author: William G.

description: I've been back here a few times when I need to grab a quick bite.  My general take is this:  it's good for large quantities of food, and the hummus and baba ghanouj are pretty good -- but the meat really isn't up to snuff.
author: Bill H.

description:
Solid little shawarma place (I don't care if they DO spell it 'shawirma') down the hill from the UCSF Parnassus campus, run by nice people. The beef/lamb shawarma is excellent -- the bread has the leathery quality that reminds me of a brief childhood stay in Beirut. 

The vegetarian sampler, with good, smoke-flavored babaghanouj, an almost liquified hummus, and a tabbouleh where where the parsley and lemon really assert themselves, also reminds me of how these things were prepared in Lebanon, even though the very nice owners are Palestinian.  But (sigh) -- if things were different we'd only be talking an hour's drive, so it doesn't surprise me that it's similarly prepared.

Great option if you're a UCSF student (or use the Millberry gym like I do) for a quick, relatively healthy bite, or are toodling around Cole or the Haight and don't mind a little detour for a nice, light meal.

Plus, Cole Valley is such a nice neighborhood for a walk!
author: Karsten P.

description:
I was rather disappointed by my experience here, but perhaps, it is because I ordered something that really didn't massage my taste buds and that is partly my own fault.

The boyfriend discovered this place on yelp and we went after a short stairway walk in the Upper Market area.  I ordered a Chicken Shish Kabab wrap.  I should have read the menu b/c it says, clearly stated that it had tahini sauce in it.  I've had tahini sauce before, but I was caught off guard that the whole mixture of roasted tomatoes, cucumber salad and seasoned onions were DOUSED with tahini sauce.

It did not agree with my stomach and after two small bites, I had to stop.  It is an afterthought, but I rarely like ANY sauces or dressing on my food.  I guess this was DEFINITELY not the best order for me and I should have tried the DINNER, as opposed to the wrap and asked it to be w/o the tahini sauce.

So, I'll be fair and say that it was not the restos fault, but most likely mine for my experience.  

 I need to give an objective review, so here it is:

1) The establishment is clean (from the customer seating area, kitchen to the bathroom)
2) The food is prepared fresh as you order it.
3) It is sorta self service (you pick your seat, grab your drink, utensils and wait for your food to come out) 
4) The seating area is small.
5) There is only a limited selection of food.
6) Parking doesn't seem to be so difficult in that area, if you don't mind walking a few blocks.

I like Mediterranean food, but I've had better in the past.  So, I have to give it two stars b/c the taste just did not agree with me. (We all have different palates)
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Chicken shawarma. Falafel. Hummus. Lamb kabobs.

All of which make Josh B. a Happy Josh B.

I guess I'm taking away one star because it's missing that last little nugget of OMG--if you will. All the food is solid, but it's not gonna explode your cranium.

First time you go, get the Chicken shawarma. It's the most solid.
author: Josh B.

description:
woooohooooo taboun! the take out never fails on a hungry weeknight! the chicken skewers, hummus and roasted veggies are delicious. super generous portions which always allow for lunch the next day too.

i like the cucumber water as you wait for your order. speedy, simple and good. 

grateful to live a few blocks from this small gem
author: Carolina S.

description: As if choosing between Yumma's and Sunrise Deli wasn't hard enough, now I've got another falafel place to throw in the mix, this one in a rather unlikely spot on the edge of Cole Valley.  If you've walked by here, you could be forgiven for thinking that Taboun must have spent all their effort on that over-the-top mural (PS: you're ruining it by having the lights on so bright.  Minus 1 star).  But the food's no joke either.  I was craving some meat this time, so I went with the shawerma wrap and it didn't disappoint.  And the falafel and baba ghanoush on the side were even better--take a crispy half-alafel piece, nestle it in a pita slice, scoop on the smoky eggplant puree, and you've got a little bite of perfection.
author: Wes M.

description: These guys make great falafel, right up there with the best in the city. Veggie combo platter is a super generous portion of veggies, hummus, tabbouleh, falafel and dolma. Great friendly service and always fast.
author: b s.

description:
I got slipped the secret pickle by Taboun. Does the menu list pickle as a component of the dish? Nope. Since falefel doesn't normally contain them I had no chance to avoid the secret pickle violation.

Taboun - keep your pickle to yourself.
author: Ricky J.

description:
Best. Falafel. Ever.

I think they may actually put crack in their falafel.  It's really that good.  

Also, the chicken kabob plate is excellent and the mojadara (sp?) is to die for.  But I would just be happy to go to Taboun, get a dozen falafel and eat them straight up.
author: John L.

description: My sister and I had a chicken shawerma and an eggplant wrap, and they were both very flavorful, yummy and huge! This is a great place to go to have a quality meal on a budget.
author: Matt H.

description: This place is yummy! I had the kefta kebab which is done like the shawarma...I actually can't figure out the difference between their kebab and shawarma but whatever, it's good. Flavorful meat and sauce and they put pickles on it too which was a really good addition! If I'm in the area, I would love to come back and try some of the sides.
author: Kristen L.

description: Good quality food at reasonable prices and good service.  I come here once a week and get the shawerma dinner plates, very tasty.
author: Joshua R.

description: I came with a group of friends and was pretty excited what I heard about this place. However, I was utterly disappointed due to the slow service. They missed my order and had to reorder after waiting about 20 minutes. Food was okay, but lost interest after my wait.
author: Leon C.

description:
Right on! Taboun is bright, clean, & dispenses well-priced falafel wraps until 10pm at night, every night. That last part is important: It's great to have an alternative to pizza slices and burritos as the night wears on.

Also, Taboun has a restaurant mural that is non-sucky -- rare indeed.
author: robin s.

description: Flat, old, flavorless, lacking in salt too - how simple is it to season food?? will not return
author: Deise R.

description: It's good... And that's probably about it. I've had about 5 things off the menu and overall, it's totally worth it for the price, totally satisfying and you're not going to be disappointed, but definitely not the best around or anything like that...
author: Nisan P.

description: The food here is very, very, very good. There's no complaining about that. But seriously, the staff makes you feel like you're bothering them when you place your order! Isn't that the point of having a restaurant? Customers come in, order food... I'd seriously think this place is some sort of front for something if their food wasn't so yummy.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Best Shawarma place in the city.

Very good tasting and super fresh food. Try the chicken shawarma or the chicken Kebab plate. Their tabule tastes very fresh and light and makes the perfect addition to a plate. 

They also have two years in a row of 100% inspection score cards on display which backs up my experience.
author: Mpunkt H.

description:
If you wander off of Cole St and explore the greater Cole Valley (well, it is really not that big to begin with) you may find yourself stumble across Taboun, a small little place with great Middle Eastern food. I have a feeling that it is family operated and they do take good care of their place. Perhaps a bit random to mention but their bathroom is so clean and nice that I almost rather use their bathroom than my own... Sorry, perhaps not something you want to read in a food review but just to give you an idea of how clean this place seems to be.

So, like I said, the food is great and so are the prices. I usually end up having the lamb shawirma (the chicken is really good to) and if you are very hungry, or just a normal guy, you might want to consider to upgrade your shawirma and get two side orders, such as hummus and tabouley, with some pita bread to go with it. If you are a vegetarian, do try their falafel, it is really good!

They do have outdoor seating but since it faces north you will not find sun here during the day.
author: Jonas B.

description:
Their prices are reasonable, their hummus and other mediterranean dips are amazing, and they serve their pita soft and warm. Best falafel I've found in SF. 

I've only tried the vegetarian plate, it's so good I don't plan on trying anything else soon. For a strictly veggie meal, it's savory, appetizing, and filling (usually good for 2 meals if I get extra pita!).
author: Em G.

description:
This place used to be a really good deal. Seems like they have raised the prices since last time I was there. Also the portions were smaller this last time I was there. The chicken shawarma plate used to be large pieces of grilled chicken with big slices of grilled tomato + rice, pita and two sides. The sides are the same but I got maybe 1/4 the amount of chicken this last time. And the price was up. 
This used to be my favorite spot near ucsf to eat but its not what it used to be.
author: j b.

description: They ran out of chicken schwarma :( sad life. The food was ok - but it might be me but the pickles in the wrap were a little strange to me. I wasn't a huge fan... the price was good and the service was quick but I'm not wow'd really. May need to give it another try... we'll see
author: linda t.

description: The lamb shawerma wrap I had was nice. But the meat was chopped up into very small slices which may appeal to some but not to me. It lacked texture. It was also rather sweet despite asking them to make it spicy. For a wrap it is somewhat pricy at over $9.
author: Somnath M.

description: Yum. Tasty food and a pretty good deal. I really liked the kefta kebab, which I was unable to run down the street and grab while my wife was preparing to have a baby.
author: Mark C.

description: I love the baba ganoush! The whole veggie plate is absolutely fantastic! Try it! Light and flavorful! The staff are friendly and greet you with a smile. A little cramped in there but it doesn't matter....Great find!
author: Mel P.

description: Excellent. Finally, an Arabic restaurant in the area. I can walk to Taboun and that is worth an extra star. The place is friendly and the food is great. I like the majadara along with everything else. Please go, I would like to see the place make it.
author: mustafa a.

description:
its not my fave anymore, but they are good. the veggie plate is delish!

it is an extremely casual place and my partner and i love to stop in here quite a bit- even though we live further down near haight...it is right off of the N-Judah.
author: turducken s.

description:
I go to taboun at least 1 or 2 times a week!  I love their schwarmas, and I really love their fries.  They may be my favorite in sf (though I haven't had that many)  

The people there are extremely nice and the food is not too expensive.  I love it.
author: Steve H.

description: Interestingly enough I just left the corner store that this man owns after being completely infuriated with him commenting on my boyfriend's disability in public and as if I didn't hear him. I and my boyfriend called him on it and he acted as if he didn't say anything. Shameless! I didn't even know that Taboun's owner was this man and it makes sense because the food is as heartless and tasteless as the owner. Can you believe this! I am embarrassed that people today can even act like that and a grown man at that! So, all in all I hope if anyone goes in there to call him out and say "Hey man, I saw this review on Yelp and it said you commented on this guy's disability (Tourettes to be exact and you said he had a coke problem" is that true. See if he owns up to it. Really! I am totally disgusted. One star is based on his gutless soul.
author: Adrienne H.

description: I've been meaning to check this place out for some time due to their use of some natural meat products (quality yes, mad cow? no thanks). Ask for extra hot sauce with the shawerma and you'll get a juicy, saucy, grilled lavash roll. Both the lamb/beef and chicken versions had well flavored moist meats. They put pickles in the shawerma, so if you're not into that, beware. The fries get points for most likely being home-made actual potatoes, but the thick cut could use 2 trips to the fryer or perhaps skip them altogether and try a different starter. I do appreciate the lime and mint in the water cooler. A solid 3.5 option if there ever was one.
author: Candice L.

description: Great value - huge wrap - reasonable price. The meat in my chicken shawerma was a slightly dry, but the flavor was fantastic. I think they forgot my hot sauce - didn't find my meal spicy at all!
author: Judy L.

description: I love my Shawerma and this place under delivered. I've never had a Shawerma with pickles, changes the taste completely.. Their hummus was ok.. Definitely not Truly Mediterranean on 16th.. that place is perfection..
author: Monica S.

description: Taboun is a newish middle eastern restaurant counter at the corner of Parnassus (Judah) and Stanyan.  They have the usual offerings of kabobs, falafel, and shawarma, but the quality is better than most shawarma places in the city.  Their tabouleh is particularly good -- very lemony.  Most people seem to do take out, but there is also a nice, small seating area.
author: Tyler N.

description: woah. Big pile of lots of food for not so much of money. I work on a veggie combo like it's my job and I've still got a meal sized pile in front of me when I'm done. Baba, hummus, tabouli, cheese, onions, salad thing with sliced pickles, AND falafel AAAAND dolmas. Oh yes, and can't forget the pita. My universe isn't realigned by eating here but the food is VERY solid. And for 6.95 and potentially two full meals, realignment isn't necessary. The falafel, however, are some of the best I've ever had. All in all, super fresh, tasty, cheap, plentiful, reasonably healthy food served in a clean attractive restaurant by skilled friendly people. Taboun has a pleasant seating area, yeay for bench seating, but not a lot of it so you may want to get your food to go during busy lunch time hours.
